citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
The May 2020 semiannual report for site 001 indicated there was a significant deficiency in general facility conditions. A
ceiling tile in the hallway had a water stain and needed to be replaced. The report noted the deficiency but did not contain
a specific plan and schedule with dates for correcting the deficiency. Additionally, the letter to the Institutional Official did
not mention any significant deficiencies. These aspects of the semiannual report ensure that the committee informs the
Institutional Official of any program deficiencies, identifies facility needs, and, if present, animal welfare issues, as well as
establishing a plan for correction of deficiencies. Animal welfare may negatively be impacted if a plan for correction of
deficiencies is not developed and followed. All semiannual reports must be reviewed and signed by a majority of the
IACUC members, include any minority views, and be submitted to the Institutional Official at least every six months.
These reports must identify and describe departures from the regulations or standards, distinguish significant from minor
deficiencies, and provide a reasonable and specific plan and schedule with dates correcting each deficiency.
TO BE CORRECTED ON THE NEXT SEMIANNUAL REPORT.
This inspection was conducted with the IACUC Chair, Lab Manager and IACUC Administrator. The exit interview was
conducted with the IACUC Chair and Administrator.
End Section
